data.title: Name the hydrocarbon
data.statement:
Hydrocarbons are chemical compounds made of hydrogen ({{H}}) and carbon ({{C}}) atoms. Each {{H}} atom forms {{1}} chemical bond, while each {{C}} atom forms {{4}} bonds.

You are given a {{5}} x [[width]]  graphical representation of some hydrocarbon, such as

`  H H H  
  | | |  
H-C=C-C-H
      |  
      H  `
where {{-}} and {{|}} are single bonds and {{=}} is a double bond (counts as two bonds). Your program should check if the compound is <<valid>> and output:

"ALKANE" if it is <<valid>> and has 0 double bonds.
"ALKENE" if it is <<valid>> and has 1 double bond.
"OTHER" if it is <<valid>> and has 2 or more double bonds.
"ERROR" if it is not <<valid>>.

A compound is <<valid>> if each {{C}} has exactly {{4}} bonds.

<<Note:>> The rest of the structure need not be checked: in particular, {{H}} atoms will always have the correct number of bonds. There is always a single horizontal chain of {{C}} atoms on row {{2}}, as in the example.

testCases.title: Validator 1
testCases.testIn:
9
  H H H  
  | | |  
H-C-C-C-H
  | | |  
  H H H

testCases.title: Validator 3
testCases.testIn:
9
  H   H  
  |   | 
H-C=C-C-H
  | | |  
  H H H

testCases.title: Validator 4
testCases.testIn:
9
  H H    
  | |    
H-C-C-C-H
  | | |  
  H H H

testCases.title: Long chain
testCases.testIn:
39
  H H H H H H H H H H H H H H H H H H  
  | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | |  
H-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-H
  | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | |  
  H H H H H H H H H H H H H H H H H H

testCases.title: Validator 7
testCases.testIn:
35
  H H H H H H H H H H H H H H H H  
  | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | |  
H-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-C-H
  | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | |  
  H H H H H H H H H H H H H H H H

testCases.title: So close
testCases.testIn:
35
  H H H H H H   H H H H H   H      
  | | | | | |   | | | | |   |      
H-C-C-C-C-C-C-C=C-C-C-C-C-C=C-C=C-H
  | | | | | | |   | | | | |   |    
  H H H H H H H   H H H H H   H

testCases.title: Validator 8
testCases.testIn:
39
    H H H H H     H H H H   H H H H H  
    | | | | |     | | | |   | | | | |  
H-C=C-C-C-C-C-C=C=C-C-C-C-C=C-C-C-C-C-H
  |   | | | | |     | | | |   | | | |  
  H   H H H H H     H H H H   H H H H

data.constraints:
5 ≤ [[width]] ≤ 40

There is always one (and only one) chain of {{C}} atoms on row 2. Row 2 never starts or ends with {{C}}.
data.stubGenerator:
read width:int

loop 5 read row:string(40)

write ALKANE/ALKENE/OTHER/ERROR
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> an integer [[width]], the width of the representation.
<<Next {{5}} lines:>> the representation of a hydrocarbon.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Hydrocarbons are chemical compounds made of hydrogen (H) and carbon (C) atoms. Each H atom forms 1 chemical bond, while each C atom forms 4 bonds.

You are given a 5 x width graphical representation of some hydrocarbon, such as

  H H H  
  | | |  
H-C=C-C-H
      |  
      H

where - and | are single bonds and = is a double bond (counts as two bonds). Your program should check if the compound is valid and output:

"ALKANE" if it is valid and has 0 double bonds.
"ALKENE" if it is valid and has 1 double bond.
"OTHER" if it is valid and has 2 or more double bonds.
"ERROR" if it is not valid.

A compound is valid if each C has exactly 4 bonds.

Note: The rest of the structure need not be checked: in particular, H atoms will always have the correct number of bonds. There is always a single horizontal chain of C atoms on row 2, as in the example.
Input
Line 1: an integer width, the width of the representation.
Next 5 lines: the representation of a hydrocarbon.
Output
"ALKANE", "ALKENE", "OTHER", or "ERROR".
Constraints
5 ≤ width ≤ 40

There is always one (and only one) chain of C atoms on row 2. Row 2 never starts or ends with C.
Example
Input
7
  H H  
  | |  
H-C-C-H
  | |  
  H H
Output
ALKANE
